alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:18PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bonneville and central Bingham Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge, or 7 miles east of Blackfoot, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and accumulating half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Accumulating hail may create hazardous driving conditions and also create poor drainage. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Goshen, Ammon, Shelley, Iona, Firth, Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge, Basalt, and Wapello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
